data.event: Lancaster was granted city status in 1937 for its "long association with the crown" and because it was "the county town of the King's Duchy of Lancaster".

event.title: existed a permanent Roman fort on the hill where Lancaster Castle now

data.event: It is known that there existed a permanent Roman fort on the hill where Lancaster Castle now stands by the end of the 1st century AD, and possibly as early as the 60s, based on the Roman coin evidence.

event.title: stands by the end of the 1st century AD

data.event: It is known that there existed a permanent Roman fort on the hill where Lancaster Castle now stands by the end of the 1st century AD, and possibly as early as the 60s, based on the Roman coin evidence.

It is known that there existed a permanent Roman fort on the hill where Lancaster Castle now stands by the end of the 1st century AD, and possibly as early as the 60s, based on the Roman coin evidence.

event.title: was not continuously inhabited in these early years

data.event: The coin evidence also suggests that the fort was not continuously inhabited in these early years.

event.title: was rebuilt in stone around 102 AD

data.event: The fort was rebuilt in stone around 102 AD.
